sense.name: limit
sense.examples: The government established a wage base.

sense.name: bottom
sense.commentary: bottom - the lowest part of a physical thing
sense.examples: The base of the mountain was only 1 mile ahead. The base of the skull was fractured in the car accident. The base of the triangle is measured to calculate the area. A tub should sit on it's own base.

sense.name: foundation
sense.commentary: fundament, foot, groundwork, substructure, understructure - lowest support of a structure or fundamental argument
sense.examples: It was build on a base of solid rock. The whole argument rested of a base of conjecture.

sense.name: principle ingredient
sense.commentary: the principle ingredient of a mixture
sense.examples: Glycerineated gelatin is used as a base for many ointments. He told the painter that he wanted a yellow base with just a hint of green. Everything she cooked seemed to have rice as a base. The base of this drink is orange juice.

sense.name: alkali
sense.commentary: any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water
sense.examples: Bases include oxides and hydroxides of metals and ammonia.

sense.name: bag
sense.commentary: the place that a runner must touch before scoring
sense.examples: He scrambled to get back to base. George slid into home base.

sense.name: station
sense.examples: The attack wiped out our forward bases. Report back to base immediately.

sense.name: infrastructure
sense.commentary: the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
sense.examples: That area's industrial base is broadly diversified, they produce everything from paper to dog food to train engines. The industrial base of the U.S. is said to rely heavily on tobacco.

sense.name: stem
sense.commentary: the form of a word after all affixes are removed
sense.examples: Thematic vowels are part of the root. The root of the word "linguistics" is "ling".

sense.name: radix
sense.commentary: the positive integer that is equivalent to one in the next higher counting place
sense.examples: 10 is the base of the decimal system.

sense.name: transistor piece
sense.commentary: the part of a transistor that separates the emitter form the collector
sense.examples: The current through the transistor base should be zero, now. The base of the transistor is found between the emitter and the collector.

sense.name: al-Qaeda
sense.commentary: Qaeda, al-Qa'ida, al-Quada, Base - an intensely anti-western terrorist network that dispenses money and logistical support and training to a wide variety of radical Islamic terrorist groups; has cells in more than 50 countries
sense.examples: Base is allegedly responsible for the attack.
